title: The Beginning
description: Norney Farm was initially tenanted by Ron Buer from the Middleton Estate.

title: Acquisition
description: The farm was acquired by the family, securing its future for generations to come.

title: Dairy Era
description: Operations were managed by Buster Buer. The farm specialised in dairy production, maintaining a herd of Jersey cows for over three decades.

title: Sheep Breeding
description: The farm transitioned to sheep breeding, focusing on Texel and Suffolk breeds.

title: Period of Inactivity
description: Norney Farm became largely inactive due to Busterâ€™s inability to continue farming and other family members pursuing external careers.

title: Revitalisation
description: Plans are now underway to revitalise and regenerate the farm. Tim Hopkin (4th Gen) is leading the charge to create a demonstration farm for regenerative land use.
